148758157.review:
I had saw this game a long time ago but ignored it being that I could just play Diablo or Torchlight. However, one day the GF said she wanted to play a new adventure game and we had trouble getting our Minecraft working so we saw this and said, "Let's try it out". Turns out that was a great decision for both of us!

MD starts off with villages getting attacked by an evil wizard known as the Illager. He is raising forces of evil and corrupting different biomes of the world. It's up to a bunch of heroes to stop his tyranny and save the captive villagers!

The story is very simple, and that's okay. You don't need a complex story for Minecraft, lol. Anyway, MD plays exactly like Diablo. It's an ARPG where you click and slay hordes of enemies and gather loot and gear for your heroes. There is a surprising amount of complexity that makes the game fun for both casual and hardcore players. 

As you play through the game, your main hub is known as the camp. Progressing through the game will allow you to save merchants who occupy your camp so you can buy loot, upgrade gear, and gift players in between missions. It's fun to see the camp grow as you play and unlock new functions the more you progress, Another form of progression is the gear and weapons you obtain. Each one has extra "traits" you can use upgrade points to make them stronger. Some are pretty cool like giving your weapon a chance to do chain lightning every few slashes or have your bow pierce through enemies. Some gear has more than one trait you can add to it instead of just one and it's really fun to mix and match them to make great combinations.

Another thing I loved was how the game rewards you for exploration. You can find extra treasures, hidden caves, and even hidden levels if you're real crafty. It made it fun to go off the beaten path and look for goodies and I appreciate the game for that. Even though the main campaign was not very long, there are a lot of DLC chapters to play through and we are eager to dive into those next.

Now for gripes. The difficulty can be a little jarring if you don't get your gear right. Luckily, you can easily adjust it, but then you can't get stronger loot which can get you stuck at certain points. I did not like the fact that you can only gift players once per mission. There is also the "Battle Pass" part of the game that lets you unlock other goodies. I didn't find them annoying or necessary, however, it can be annoying to some players, and just wanted to put it out there so players are aware.

Final verdict? We really enjoyed this game. It was the perfect amount of challenge for both of us and we are eager to dive into the DLC chapters. For $20, we definitely got our money's worth. It's a fun weekend game or co-op game to dive into with your friends, ESPECIALLY if you love Minecraft. It's fun to see how they used enemies from the game and Diablo-fied them. If you're looking for a fun and cute Diablo Clone, this may be the one to scratch that itch you have. Thanks for reading!

147532122.review:
Before you say I didn't play the game that much, most of my hours are on the Xbox/MC Launcher version of Dungeons, not on Steam with nearly 200+.

I really want to give this a positive review but Mojang really dropped the ball with this game and I can only hope Minecraft Legends doesn't suffer the same fate as Minecraft Dungeons and Earth did via slow burn or abrupt uncontrollable circumstance and not wanting to stick out the storm.

The main reason I chose negative is that it took almost 2 years to get basic features like a simple storage system/chest to be added which meant we had to choose what to keep.
This compounds with the event/seasonal exclusive weapons/gear you could get (which at the time before they got added to the Tower in that update) were objectively worse in power level so they were just a status symbol to show off to the tiny playerbase that you were there that was useless on the higher tier apocalypse difficulties. Not helping is that one of them being the corrupted pumpkin is still unobtainable because they didn't add artifacts to the tower despite their being in the steam and MC feedback site. Many request for QOL features fell on deaf ears for cutesy corp speak and additions that add little or are cosmetic instead of addressing problems like needless bloat and clutter (such as consolidating the reskinned gear into being a toggle instead of separate items entirely being one example of a missed opportunity).
The big elephant in the room is the one they neglected and gave a outright no to when asked to add; modding support or at least Steam workshop support.
Half the fun of being on Steam is the workshop and the fact they opted out of allowing you to mod more easily and safely by downloading mods through the workshop which is built in and instead just said no and offered no way speaks volumes to their attitude on modding outside of the Java edition which I'm convinced they only keep around to keep the Java devs employed and quell discourse because I'm sure they'd want Minecoin integration similar to what they did with Legends.

Workshop/modding support could have added a infinite content and extended the life of dungeons but instead Mojang opted to release a season pass system for this game, only released 3, then missed not only the winter event, but the games anniversary, didn't say or make a blog post about its birthday, then proceed to boast their player numbers of 25+M players in dungeons despite most of those being gamepass buyers who tried it and NOT concurrent players who return and then cut support/sunsetted the game about a week ago.

No goodbye, no fanfare, no final event, no cosmetic crossover/carryover for what you bought in MC Dungeons from the seasons passes/challenges like with Minecraft earth to keep as keepsakes like emotes, capes, or pets, no more events; its finished, over. The bare minimum they're doing now is just having a tower level be procedural generated off of present pre-sets every week while keeping purchase servers up for your cosmetics; that's it.

TLDR; If you're thinking of buying this game for long term content or playing with friends, don't bother. The games officially over/discontinued and no more DLC or content is being made/updated. They did quite a poor job of marketing this game as well as their other Minecraft spinoffs or published games such as Minecraft Story mode, Earth, Scrolls(Callers Bane), Cobalt, and now Legends.

Don't bother getting this game unless you REALLY like dungeon crawlers and even then there's much better than this game that are actually actively being updated. Legends sadly might follow the same fate as Dungeons if Mojang's actions with their past games are repeated.

147326430.review: Minecraft Dungeons is a top-down Dungeon crawler. I thoroughly enjoyed this game and loved all of the mechanics and how the enchants work. One of the only things i don't like about Minecraft Dungeons is that it is quite short (took my 4.6 hours to complete the main story) and doesn't have much replayability besides the multiple difficulties, the easiest difficulty is Default, hard difficulty Adventure and the hardest difficulty Apocalypse. There is also a tower mode where you start off with basic armour and gear and slowly progress up the tower gaining 1 piece of gear or armour every storey, as you progress higher and higher the levels will get harder and you will start stumbling across boss levels until you reach the highest storey level 22 and will get a prize of your choice and if you die midway you will also gain some gear but not as good gear. If you do find the game short you can buy the DLCs which either give you more skins or adds more levels to complete (all DLC is $29.95 AD). Overall i would give the base game a 7.5 out of 10.

As I was looking for an hack & slash, i found this game. Never played the original Minecraft though.

Gameplay is fun for 5 minutes then you realise, there are very little different area. Second, there are no skills or build. Every power comes from your weapons so if you find a great weapon you'll use it for an hour and you'll play something else afterwards because it became obsolete in 30 minutes. Thus, you can't play a gameplay that you like for long (well you'll have to farm for weapons with those powers/enchantments). You're forced into a melee weapon, a ranged weapon and 3 artifacts. Just have to use the power of those 5 objets.

As a consequence, no build no class means there is absolutely no re-playability in this game... 

Give it a try when it's on mega sales because it's definitely not worse it at full price (knowing there are DLC as well, and I haven't tried those. 

Too bad as the game isn't badly executed, it's just a too simplified hack & slash. Might be a good introduction to those not used to this type of game though

146584422.review:
This game produces a few hours of fun, with nice customisation and goals.
However once you get past apocalypse, nothing changes.

Gameplay becomes very stale, with the only difference being that enemies get more and more ridiculous benefits and enchantments that the game becomes impossible to beat.

The controls are complete ass, half the time not even working as intended.

The AI is very bad. Half the time stun works, half the time it doesn't. Half the time enemies will walk up to you and do nothing. You can kill redstone golems by standing directly in front of them and attacking until it dies. You can spawn a pet (Wolf, Llama, Iron Golem) and they will quite commonly just stand there and do nothing.

Weapon and artefact balancing basically doesn't exist, with many items being broken and some just being worse versions of existing tools.

Hitboxes are very whack, youre often able to hit enemies you didnt come five metres near to hitting- and enemies can hit you from where you just were before you rolled (rolling is essentially useless for combat).

TLDR;

Game becomes over boring and grindy.
Controls dont work half the time and are just awful in general.
Ai sucks overall
Balancing doesnt exist
Hitboxes and hurtboxes feel like they were left in a prototype setting.
Also, the game will often spawn so many enemies that the game lags beyond belief.

Oh and another thing, this game has (on numerous occassions) crashed my entire PC, despite my PC running far more demanding games and has no struggle running it. It just randomly crashes.
(it will also crash if you enter a game and leave in under 5 seconds).

Do not buy this game and give money to Mojang.

MAKE A FUNCTIONAL GAME

The game is obviously abandoned by Mojang after the attempts to revive it failed, though without a doubt, this game is one of the best dungeon crawlers out there. This game started out real good, the whole dungeon fits the Minecraft feel, with nice but unpolished maps.

I just wish they didn't completely stop after 2022. This game is dead, not much chance for it being picked back up. Why am I still recommending it? The game's fun, there's grinding, but there's also new stuff. I picked this back up this month and genuinely enjoyed it, so I decided to write a review.

Recommendations about the DLCs? Buy all of them. The season passes? They don't expire so just buy them if you want to amuse yourself with the cosmetics.

I guess that's all.

145923300.review:
I used to play this game a ridiculous amount on my switch, all the way through including the DLCs in both Default and Adventure and after having not played it in a good while, my friend gifted me the steam version to play together. Even after having to adjust to the game again I still love this game. It plays like Diablo but its very different in its execution which I can appreciate.

[i]I do have my gripes however,[/i] small things like Chests just not being in alternate pathways, dodging slowing you down until your next dodge is recharged, the lock on being sticky dragged the game down for some of my friends. They're just annoyances for me, but they can be turn offs for others.

Combat is very enjoyable, there are very few movesets I actually dislike, and all the weapons feel very unique. Artifacts are very powerful and all offer a unique purpose making combat very flexible and fun.

Most maps are surprisingly open, with secret paths and entryways in each level, letting people like me who want to explore the entire map get plenty of enjoyment doing so. A certain [spoiler]Creeping Crypt[/spoiler] does get [i]too[/i] open tho, requiring multiple levels of time to explore, you are rewarded for your time however.

The game can get difficult if your not running a very powerful build especially on the harder difficulties, but you can get by running something unorthodox. Some things do unfortunately fall off though, like Summons.

There are no stats or spells of any kind, your build is entirely based on your equipment. I love this system much more than a stat system, allowing swapping a build easily without making a new character and making theory-crafting a build much easier

This game looks absolutely phenomenal. The post processing is just right, not being over abundant to keep its style intact, but also making the game prettier than Minecraft could ever wish to be. The builds for the stages look amazing too, with diverse sets of blocks and new blocks to make transitions from dirt to stone bricks look prettier than ever. I thought I was crazy being really inspired by some of the structures built in this game, but even my friend has gotten ideas for builds from this game too.

All the DLCs are amazing, with Flames of the Nether and Hidden Depths being my absolute favorites. They all add new stages and new 

Of course, this being a (fairly) modern game, it has a ✨Battle Pass✨, but its one of the best in my opinion. Its a bit of a grind, but the tracks aren't time limited, they can be completed well after the season ends giving you ample time to get it done even if your behind. the premium track is only 4$, far cheaper than most games with a battle pass and includes particle effects for killing mobs, healing and teleporting to other players. It has pets, skins and capes to get too. The base game is kinda pricey for how short it is, being 20$, but the DLC is super cheap for just how much they add. Pick the Ultimate Edition up on a sale and I'm sure you'll enjoy it greatly.

144023828.review:
Played this game with my girlfriend, while I enjoy the hardcore aspect of DiabloIV or any other similar RPG games, I do appreciate how they approach Minecraft Dungeons. There are many things that shine while playing with a non-gamer player: 
- Loot is not shareable. I would love to go for BIS item and play style, however, it's okay for me. 
- The combat mechanic is a little bit too easy and reward you for going crazy instead of respecting the boss mechanic. I had 2 boss fights, all of them rewarded you for rushing in and burnt em' down. The reaction time to dodge mechanic was insanely low and almost impossible to dodge (at least for me and my girlfriend). 
- On the other hand, there are sweet things bout this game. Firstly, thematic wise, it's really kid friendly (doesn't have any hardcore gore, betrayal, etc). Secondly, it's easy to cruise through a mission/dungeon just by running and slashing. 
- The dungeon map is pretty much linear, there aren't any thing to explore, just some extended areas that is obvious and you can't miss it. 

In the end, if you are looking for any hardcore game, I suggest other titles such as Diablo IV for fast-pace, gear grinding or Baldur's Gate 3 for one of the best games ever created. On the contrary, I highly recommend if you accept how casual this game is.

143887581.review:
Minecraft Dungeons is a delightful and refreshing take on the beloved sandbox universe that has captured the hearts of players for years. This action-adventure gem from Mojang Studios offers a new perspective on the Minecraft universe, combining its iconic blocky charm with exhilarating gameplay and captivating exploration.

Right from the moment you step into the world of Minecraft Dungeons, you're greeted with the same familiar aesthetic that made the original game a global phenomenon. The voxel-style graphics are beautifully reimagined, creating a visually appealing experience that's both nostalgic and innovative. The attention to detail in each environment is astounding, making every corner of the game a joy to explore.

The gameplay of Minecraft Dungeons is where the magic truly happens. This action-packed dungeon crawler introduces a streamlined combat system that's easy to pick up, yet deeply satisfying to master. The variety of weapons, armor, and artifacts allow for versatile playstyles, encouraging experimentation and strategic thinking. The cooperative multiplayer aspect amplifies the enjoyment, allowing you and your friends to team up and conquer challenges together.

One of the standout features of Minecraft Dungeons is its approachable nature. While the game retains the complexity and depth that fans love, it's also incredibly accessible to newcomers. The intuitive controls and straightforward mechanics ensure that players of all ages and skill levels can jump right in and start having fun. This inclusivity is a testament to Mojang Studios' commitment to creating experiences that resonate with a wide audience.

The progression system in Minecraft Dungeons is addictively rewarding. As you battle your way through hordes of mobs and bosses, you'll earn loot and experience points that enhance your character's abilities. The thrill of discovering powerful gear and watching your character grow stronger is an exhilarating journey that keeps you invested in the game's world.

The game's narrative, while simple, is charming and effective. The quest to thwart the Arch-Illager's plans is a classic hero's journey, and the game's lighthearted tone adds an extra layer of enjoyment. While the story might not be the most complex, it serves as a solid foundation for the adventurous gameplay and exploration that Minecraft Dungeons offers.

Minecraft Dungeons' ongoing support through updates and expansions further enhances its value. Mojang Studios continues to provide fresh content that introduces new challenges, areas, and gear, keeping the game experience exciting and ever-evolving.

In conclusion, Minecraft Dungeons is a triumph in its own right. It takes the essence of the Minecraft universe and crafts an engaging and accessible dungeon-crawling adventure that's perfect for solo players and co-op enthusiasts alike. The game's blend of action, exploration, and loot progression creates an addictive loop that's hard to put down. Mojang Studios has once again proven their ability to innovate and deliver an experience that resonates with players of all backgrounds. Minecraft Dungeons is a gem that shines brightly in the world of action-adventure gaming.

One of the best simple arpg dungeon crawlers ever with no seasonal character resets. All the momories and fun, weapon builds and diversity. Simple is more with MCD. 

However anyone buying this game in 2023 should be aware:

I've been with MCD on the Microsoft store, swith, xbox, and steam. I've played this game since the start. I have over 300 hours across all platforms and saves (steam i got recently to play with my Significant Other). I am abysmally sad to see microcock has silently rug pulled a game they said to "seasonally update" after 3 fucking updates. November 20 2022 was the last update MCD received and iut's clear they have zero intentions to even put in the most basic effort of holiday event reruns to keep the game alive.. No more easily rerunable holiday or anniversary events, no updates on new content, no seasonal events past the third update despite promising seasonal consistent updates,. The last update added tower multiplayer, a new armor, and a new artifact. Since november 20 2022 the game has been purely fucking silent. No teasers, no more posts on the twitter even. The game for all it's worth got three "seasonal" updates that were minimal and often extremely delayed, then left to rot.

For what MCD has though, that rotting corpse is worth the memories. I just wish Microsoft would realize they have a big market to the casual arpg dungeon crawl audience and could actually compete with d4 easily had they just kept platforming and developing this game. RIP MCD, thanks for the memories.

142741810.review:
Rating: ★★★★★

I've been a long-time fan of Minecraft, and when I heard about Minecraft Dungeons, I was both excited and curious. Let me tell you, this game absolutely lives up to the hype! It takes the beloved blocky world we all know and love and transforms it into an action-packed dungeon-crawling adventure that's both challenging and incredibly fun.

The first thing that struck me was the game's visual style. The classic Minecraft charm is maintained, and yet, the environments and characters have been beautifully reimagined to fit the dungeon-crawling genre. Every level is a work of art, and the attention to detail is impressive, from the way the light filters through the trees to the unique designs of each enemy you encounter.

The gameplay is where Minecraft Dungeons truly shines. The controls are smooth and intuitive, making it easy to jump right into the action. Whether you're a seasoned gamer or new to the genre, you'll find the mechanics accessible and enjoyable. It's an excellent gateway for players of all ages to dive into the world of dungeon-crawlers.

The combat system is addictive, and the variety of weapons and gear you can collect keeps you constantly experimenting with new strategies. The thrill of finding rare loot after defeating a challenging boss is incredibly rewarding. The game encourages both solo play and cooperative multiplayer, and teaming up with friends makes the experience even more enjoyable.

Another aspect that impressed me was the progression system. As you level up, you earn enchantment points that allow you to customize your gear with unique abilities, further enhancing your playstyle. This adds a layer of depth to the gameplay and keeps you engaged in the long run.

I also appreciate how the developers continuously update the game with new content and features. It shows their dedication to providing a fresh and ever-evolving experience for players.

If I had to find a flaw, I'd say that the game's story could be a bit more elaborate. While it's not the central focus, a more immersive narrative would have added even more depth to the experience.

In conclusion, Minecraft Dungeons is a delightful addition to the Minecraft universe. Its captivating visuals, addictive gameplay, and cooperative multiplayer elements make it a must-play for fans of the franchise and dungeon-crawling enthusiasts alike. Mojang has once again proven their ability to create compelling and enjoyable experiences, and I can't wait to see what they have in store for the game's future.

141490541.review:
Bought the ultimate edition fairly recently. I had played the game previously on Xbox game-pass, and had a decent amount of fun. But now that I've payed the $40 for the included DLCs, I seriously would not recommend this game.

The whole point of the game is combat, and leveling up your gear. The game fundamentally fails at this on numerous levels. The gear you obtain is almost immediately outclassed by randomly dropped loot from mobs, so there is no real incentive to upgrade the gear you have. Emeralds are another issue entirely. You spend most of the missions navigating horribly structured levels (I will go into detail later) for your only reward, if any at all, to be a couple emeralds which you can't spend outside of upgrading your gear (Which I've already explained is pointless.)

The level design is abhorrent. I often get lost trying to figure out where I'm supposed to be going, and this isn't helped by the fact that the only support the game offers (An almost invisible marker which is frequently covered by the HUD) only works half the time, and will often disappear completely, or as I have mentioned, become covered by the HUD.

This game has little to no redeeming qualities. Even the combat, which most dungeon crawlers are known for, feels clunky and unfinished. For the price, I recommend purchasing Diablo, or other established dungeon crawlers. Especially for that disgusting $40 price tag.

141407553.review: DO NOT BUY WITHOUT OWNING A CONTROLLER, there is no option for wasd or changing the movement controls at all in this game. if you do not own a controller or dont mind having bad mouse movement which doesnt flow with the game and removes most of the fun from it i would absolutely not buy the game. if they sort this problem out then it may be an alright game.

BEFORE YOU BUY: CONTROLLER IS SUPER-HIGHLY RECOMMENDED (the keyboard and mouse controls suck *** and you cant change them) it uses point-and-click movement on mouse, and doesn't allow WASD controls. i get it because that's how these kinda games are made, but it is so unwieldy asf.

asides from the lack of control customization, the game is amazing.

there really aren't any major downsides besides the crappy keyboard controls. sometimes the game might crash, but that's just because my drivers are outdated and i don't bother to update them. 

9/10 Gameplay: very good and entertaining, with many options for challenge

4/10(no controller) 
8/10 Grind: average grind, its not boring to grind but the rewards are *mostly* randomized so you don't usually get exactly what you want.
Overall Rating: 32/40
or 7.5/10

Its a fun game to relax with friends and fans of the IP but its very much a bare and lightened version of Diablo 3s formula. Very repetitious and next to no end game. The Tower offers the most replay value but is semi detached from the actual progression with exceptions to the rewards you gain from completed the weeks Tower. 

Great for kids you want to get into Diablo when they get old enough but not much good for long term value, The DLC only adds 3 levels a piece and while there are new enemy types it feels lack luster and leaves you wishing more was added with each one. Overall good for a few days grind if you're an adult but if you have a kid tagging along it may add more time to the experience

140620196.review:
[h1][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/44230955/]Follow Narmaya Onee-chan's Curator here![/url][/h1]
Minecraft Dungeons was really enjoyable although it was not the Path of Exile experience Onee-chan had been expecting. All main story maps and DLCs were cleared within 10-20 hours, after which the objective of the game felt far more shallow. Darlings will find it fun to continuously polish builds and strengthen gear, but the gameplay begins to feel repetitive when clearing the same maps over and over again.

Unlike Path of Exile, there isn't much replay value other than experimenting with new builds. The campaign was short and the incentive to progress post-game wasn't exactly strong. The lack of skill trees and an inferior version of gem links in the form of enhancements lack depth. Nonetheless, progression can be very satisfying and there is an abundance of playstyles to try out.

If darlings are getting an Online-Play Restricted error when attempting to co-op, make sure to check the Family Xbox Settings, and allow it to connect with players online. Darlings may have to amend this setting in the guardian's Xbox account if the account owner belongs to a minor.

140407244.review:
"माइनक्राफ्ट अंधारकोठडी" हा एक अॅक्शन-अ‍ॅडव्हेंचर गेम आहे जो प्रिय माइनक्राफ्ट विश्वावर एक रोमांचक ट्विस्ट सादर करतो. मोजांग स्टुडिओने विकसित केलेला, हा गेम खेळाडूंना राक्षस, खजिना आणि आव्हानांनी भरलेल्या जगात एक अनोखा अनुभव देतो.

"माइनक्राफ्ट अंधारकोठडी" मध्ये, खेळाडू एका शूर नायकाची भूमिका घेतात जो दुष्ट आर्च-इलेगर आणि त्याच्या भयंकर प्राण्यांच्या सैन्याला पराभूत करण्याच्या शोधात निघतो. त्यांच्या संपूर्ण प्रवासात, ते प्रक्रियात्मकरित्या तयार केलेल्या अंधारकोठडीचे अन्वेषण करतील, शक्तिशाली शत्रूंचा सामना करतील आणि मौल्यवान खजिना आणि उपकरणे गोळा करतील.

या गेमच्या प्रमुख वैशिष्ट्यांपैकी एक म्हणजे त्याचा सहकारी गेमप्ले, जो खेळाडूंना तीन मित्रांपर्यंत ऑनलाइन किंवा स्थानिक पातळीवर एकत्रितपणे आव्हानांचा सामना करण्यास अनुमती देतो. शत्रूंच्या टोळ्यांवर मात करण्यासाठी आणि आव्हानात्मक अंतिम बॉसला तोंड देण्यासाठी एक संघ म्हणून काम करणे, कौशल्ये आणि समन्वय साधणे आवश्यक आहे.

मोहक आणि पिक्सेलेटेड व्हिज्युअल शैलीसह, "माइनक्राफ्ट अंधारकोठडी" Minecraft चे सौंदर्यात्मक सार राखून ठेवते, परंतु कृती आणि लढाईसाठी अधिक केंद्रित दृष्टीकोन देते. खेळाडूंची प्रगती होत असताना, ते नवीन क्षमता, शस्त्रे आणि चिलखत अनलॉक करतात, ज्यामुळे त्यांना त्यांची खेळण्याची शैली सानुकूलित आणि वर्धित करता येते.

मुख्य मोहिमेव्यतिरिक्त, गेममध्ये अतिरिक्त आव्हाने, साइड क्वेस्ट्स आणि लपविलेले खजिना आणि रहस्ये शोधण्यासाठी प्रक्रियात्मकरित्या व्युत्पन्न केलेल्या स्तरांचा शोध घेण्याची संधी देखील आहे.

थोडक्यात, "माइनक्राफ्ट अंधारकोठडी" हा एक रोमांचक आणि प्रवेशजोगी गेम आहे जो Minecraft विश्वामध्ये एक अनोखा अनुभव देतो. को-ऑप अॅक्शन, आकर्षक व्हिज्युअल शैली आणि विविध प्रकारच्या आव्हानांवर लक्ष केंद्रित करून, Minecraft चाहत्यांसाठी आणि अॅक्शन-अ‍ॅडव्हेंचर गेम प्रेमींसाठी ही एक उत्तम निवड आहे.

139834235.review:
There's some fun here, but it gets too repetitive after a while. The general idea of a Minecraft-themed dungeon crawler is excellent. The mechanics themselves feel very good, but (especially on greater difficulties) it becomes an annoying grind that is only fun/satisfying with piercing weapons. The bosses are either too easy (like the supposed final boss) or will instantly kill you with extremely high DPS (COUGH, COUGH, CORRUPTED CAULDRON.)

(SERIOUSLY WHY DOES A BOSS IN A MELEE-ORIENTED GAME INSTANTLY KILL YOU IF YOU GET TOO CLOSE TO IT TO TRY AND HIT IT WITH SAID MELEE WEAPONS?
YOU KNOW, COUNTERING 'OUT DPS THE BOSS' METHODS COULD'VE BEEN DONE WITH KNOCKBACK ATTACKS.)

Anyway...
Another main gripe is the controls. I understand some people have difficulty using WASD and the number keys simultaneously, but why are you forced to play the whole game like a point-and-click adventure? 

This game has more 'Walk forward and hold M1' gameplay than TF2 and is easier to play one-handed than most porn games on Steam.

The cross-platform gameplay also doesn't work between Steam users and Minecraft launcher users, sadge

In summary, it's still pretty fun, but it's pretty easy to get bored. This is a 'I'm just killing time/Waiting for another game to install' type game.

TL:DR;

Pros:
* Great mechanics
* Cool looking weapons
* Unique enemy designs

Cons:
* Gets repetitive
* Imbalanced bosses (too easy or too hard)
* Annoying mouse controls
* Somewhat lack of content without DLC
And the biggest con of all....
* 90% of these mobs aren't in vanilla Minecraft.

139332055.review:
This is a charming, yet very simple entry in the “Diablo”-like genre. Instead of classes your character build it completely reliant on the equipment you use. So there is no wrong skilling or hard decisions to be made, because everything can be changed with a few mouse clicks. There is also a simple upgrade system for weapons. For every level you gain, you get a gem that can be used to unlock skills in your gear. Gear can be dismantled anytime to regain all spent gems, so there is no wrongdoing here either. While simple, it still offers plenty of possibilities to form a character of your liking. The classic stereotypes like mages, summoners or barbarians can be put together with the right equipment. There are also some nice synergies between some equipment to make it even more efficient.

Despite its simplicity and a shallow hit feedback from enemies, I had quite some fun with Minecraft Dungeons. I couldn’t play it for hours without end, but for shorter sessions it is a nice gap filler. I recommend the complete package with all the DLC because it adds a lot of levels and variety to the mix. The game is rather short otherwise, but the open ended leveling process, highly scalable missions and seasons passes - that are not time-gated! - will give plenty of playtime if you are into grinding stuff out. Just don’t expect a complex beast like Path of Exile or Grim Dawn that offers plenty of replayability and more interesting stuff to experiment with.

139145381.review:
After reading and asking a lot of feedbacks from other players from reddit and discord servers. I've gathered a conclusion that while minecraft dungeon is a really fun game, the game becomes a wasted potential due to horrible and irresponsible management from the Devs.

The end game of the game is really pointless due to the fact that the only place where people would grind for late game gears is "The Tower". And the Tower is a comp-on content, which means everyone starts the run in The Tower with default gears given by the system, we can't use our own gears that we got throughout the game. 

Now, it's ok if The Tower is a content to grind for special gears to challenge other end game contents in the game, however, The Tower is  a content which invalidate all other contents. Because the loots dropped from The Tower are the strongest and most rarest loots, and are not possible to grind or find anywhere else in the game. In another word, there is no point in playing any other contents or raid or dungeons beside just constantly and repetitively grind The Tower over and over again.
And after you've gotten the best loots from the Tower, you can't even use it in The Tower due to the comp-on aspect.

The RNG factor is quite horrible so you're forced to consistently retry The Tower to get the correct gear sets. Doing any other contents in the game is simply not worth it because their drops are never as rare as The Tower's.

Not to mention, the biggest issue which is still on-going till this day, is there exist a abusive glitch in The Tower which anyone can do it to amplify the rewards to give out game-breaking gears with insane stats to 1tap or 2tap every max difficulties contents in the game. I have no idea why this glitch was never fixed.

In short, you are spending 40$ to have a game with a repetitive and messed up and abusive end game system, The Tower, which invalidate all other contents by :
> Doesn't even allow you to use your own gears
> Give loots far better than all other contents in the game so you are forced to spam the Tower.

while also invalidating all your progress efforts putting into the game if you've grinded up to this point. Not to mention you can already gain access to the Tower after just 5-10 mins of playing because it's available right away just after the tutorial.

This game was actually surprisingly good. I had initially come in with low expectations [spin-off games are seldom anything to write home about, I had anticipated a low effort mess with minecraft branding slapped onto it] but it exceeded them in pretty much every regard.

While this kind of gameplay isn't usually my jam I find it really fun to with friends. [And a decent time on my own.] The weapons are really enjoyable and it's always fun to mix and match equipment together. My only gripe would probably be that I'd prefer a bit more of a bumpin ost, but I have to admit the ost as it stands is pretty faithful to the original game, so I can respect it in it's current state.

Overall I think it's worth getting if you enjoy minecraft and that kind of gameplay. Though I wouldn't recommend it as strongly if you don't have friends to play it with. [I found it getting a bit boring and repetitive when playing on my own.]

136947313.review:
Minecraft Dungeons is a dungeon-crawling spin-off of the massively popular sandbox game Minecraft. Developed by Mojang Studios and Double Eleven, Minecraft Dungeons was released in May 2020 and is available on multiple platforms, including Xbox, PlayStation, Nintendo Switch, and PC.

As a fan of both Minecraft and dungeon-crawling games, I was excited to try Minecraft Dungeons, and I have to say that I was not disappointed. The game features a simple yet engaging story that follows a group of heroes as they battle the Arch-Illager and his minions to save the land from darkness.

One of the most impressive aspects of Minecraft Dungeons is its accessibility. The game is easy to pick up and play, even for those who have never played a dungeon-crawling game before. The controls are intuitive, and the game provides helpful tips and tutorials to guide players through the basics.

Something good about having this on Steam is that I can import a custom skin! Thank you modders!

It's a great way to introduce someone to hack/slash and get loot games.  Especially if they are children But please do not think this is a game for just children.  After doing all the ruin stuff (if you don't know what that is, then you have some gaming to do) and unlocking all the secret levels, what should you do? The TOWER has the best loot in the game.  Solo it if you want but the more people in your party and if you can finish it ... BEST. LOOT. IN. THE. GAME. Weird. A multiplayer game that wants you to team up.  Many players who want to team up look at the discussions or the forums.  Help others. Nothing is more stress-relieving than getting on 25 Apocalypse and slaughtering everything while helping others. Please remember to throw some items into the blacksmith before you dungeon so you can level the excellent gear. What are you waiting for? Kill, Loot, Repeat.

135428441.review: If you like minecraft but are bored of singleplayer and want a challenging adventure, this game is 100% for you.Minecraft Dungeons mixes fun gameplay with interesting mechanics and just builds on the world of minecraft so much more. The story revolves around the arch illager, a villager who finds a strange orb and becomes a cruel ruler, capturing and destroying them and their houses. The storyline isn't too special, however, to take down the arch illager, the player goes through many different areas and challenges, all with special secret areas that you can unlock within them. You can collect and make use of armors, melee weapons, bows, and items, all of which can pack a punch against enemy mobs. Melee weapons are, well, melee weapons, armors are armors, bows are ranged items, and all of which take on different variants and types, with an enchantment system in place. You gain enchantment points by leveling up, and they can be used to enchant any type of equippable. Enchantments can be tons of different things, from making a melee weapon deal fire damage, to making fire explode from behind you when you roll, to making pets deal more damage, to making lightning strike wherever you hit. You can equip up to 3 items, which can do different things, from summoning a llama to fight for you, to summoning a beam of darkness to engulf and destory your enemies. In addition, after you beat the main game, there is still adventure and nightmare mode, not to mention the many DLC'S!There's a lot more I could say, but all I think I need to say is that I highly recommend this game if you like minecraft! (9/10 in my opinion)Go buy minecraft dungeons!

135298566.review:
What can I say about Minecraft Dungeons...

It's not a bad game, but I expected more from it. The gameplay is not very engaging and quickly becomes tedious, especially when you're replaying the same levels over and over again. And while there are different quests and enemies, it all quickly becomes predictable and monotonous. The graphics didn't impress me either. They don't meet my expectations and seem outdated. I didn't expect such a level of graphics from a game released in 2020. Additionally, the game can be quite buggy, with lag and loading problems. But there are some pros. For example, Minecraft Dungeons can be interesting for those who enjoy playing co-op. Sometimes it can even be fun when you play with your friends. Also, the game can be simple for beginners who are just starting out in the genre.

So, if you're looking for a game with great graphics and an exciting gameplay, I would suggest looking for something else.

134021185.review:
After playing this game, I realize that some of these review that say that they "finish game and dlc in 6 hours" are just liars. 

I really enjoy a hack'n'slash looting games and this one surprise me. I had my doubts when I made the purchase. I started to love the game from a new player point-of-view. I have play in both solo/group and it's fun. The grind and loot is great and I look forward for more loot as the game gets harder.
If you want a CRAZY LOOKING skill tree and SUPER complex classes, this isn't your game. This game is a very simple and easy to understand version of "path of exile". I am just still in the base game and will update my review once I get further in. Atm I would recommend this game to people! :)

133684562.review:
[code]Minecraft風格的ARPG，早期遊戲性不錯
但中後期體驗會愈來愈差[/code]
[h1]優點[/h1]
[list]
[*]Minecarft 風格
[*]部份地圖是隨機生成，不會過度重覆
[*]多人遊戲
[/list]
[h1]缺點[/h1]
[list]
[*]中後期數據膨脹嚴重
[*]裝備的變數很少，能用的附魔不多
[*]過多控場怪物
[*]欠缺很多QOL功能
[/list]

遊戲性
早期解鎖和嘗試各種能力時不錯
中期開始有固定Build後，只有單純的刷分
打怪的獎勵很少，也不常掉裝備
貨幣的收入基本沒變，一場下來最多也就幾百(綠寶石和金塊)
慢慢變成直接打最短的關卡刷商人/鐵匠
後期數據膨脹嚴重
早期裝備相差10分可能就差幾百傷害，後期差1分傷害就已經差個幾千幾萬
怪物的血量直接提升到數千萬級，附上各種控場秒殺的精英怪，體驗變得愈來愈差

DLC
新的裝備不錯，但地圖的設計有點噁心
像一接近就爆炸的秒殺植物，在水底得不停找氧氣
雖然是整體是取自Minecraft的元素，但體驗非常差

QOL
遊戲系統不能儲存Preset，換Build都要靠自己記下哪件配哪件
裝備不能上鎖，不小心拆除錯了就GG
裝備上沒有標記遠古狩獵的符文，不方便日常儲備符文
滿級後裝等還是有浮動值，很常掉到低級別的物品

Bug
遠古狩獵 在多人遊戲中如果有人取消準備，等級和裝備就會直接消失
雖然官方說了是已知問題，但幾個月過去了完全沒有任何更新的打算
多人遊戲也很常吃掉技能，CD在數了但完全沒有效果

Es un juego increíblemente divertido y adictivo que ofrece una experiencia emocionante de juego de aventuras! Como jugador, te encontrarás sumergido en un mundo vibrante y colorido lleno de peligros y aventuras por igual.

131912404.review:
The gameplay itself is  fun enough if repetitive. I just wanted something simple to play while I listened to podcasts. But I was compelled to leave my first review ever because of the horrendous DRM applied to this game. 

-you need to login with your microsoft account to play. Which is fine except for that it doesn't seem to always remember your credentials, so you need to relogin often. And it makes it so you can never play truly offline.

-say you switch between steam deck and PC. Every time you play on one device, when you finish you need to upload your character, then download it on the other device to play there. Why is this necessary???

-on steam deck, I often need to restart the game multiple times to actually get to the game. Sometimes a white rectangle will show instead of the login box. So I restart. Sometimes I can't access the menu to download my previous save, so I need to restart.

Plus some gameplay issues:
- if you enchant something, you can't enchantment without getting rid of the weapon entirely

-IMPORTANT: you can't ever truly pause the game, even in "offline" (but not actually offline, you still need to login) mode. Bring up the menu, you can still get attacked and killed by mobs. Some of the maps I've played can take at least 45 minutes to complete. Very weird choice.

After the 5th time dealing with the upload/download thing, I got tired and decided to stop entirely. It can be fun, but not fun enough to deal with that.

Microsoft--if you're not going to take advantage of the cloud-save features that dang near every other steam game uses, including indie games with a single developer, don't put it here. I don't know much about game development or steam integration but I have to imagine your employees are capable of figuring it out, clearly this is a weird business decision. Do better or don't use steam.

131315561.review:
A very slight yes.

Pros
- Quite a lot of content for the price
- Easy to pick up and play, but can be surprisingly deep with the different available builds
- Bosses and puzzles can be quite complex. Not yet raid level, but complex enough to be a refreshing challenge each time
- If you enjoy buildcrafting and you enjoy rogue-like dungeon crawling, you will enjoy MC:D

Cons
- Click to move. Handles like a drunken washing machine sometimes. Very easy for your character to pathfind into an obstacle, get stuck and consequently get killed. Inconceivable why a PC version of the game has controller support but not WASD movement support.
- No auto cloudsave option despite requiring you to play with an active internet connection and being signed in to Microsoft Services. Why?
- No online matchmaking so no random lobbies to join. You need to have actual friends pr at least know people to be able to enjoy the multiplayer experience.
- Gets repetitive when you're into Apocalyse Plus.

- Theres no leveling system so you never actually get to feel your character's power grow. Instead you have 3 pieces of gear, melee armor and bow (not ranged since I guess coming up with a long distance weapon that didnt involve sticks and string was too hard) but hey that would be fine if finding new gear was fun and exciting right?

 - actually finding gear is a pain in the fucking ass and 90% of the gear you do manage to scrounge up is garbage you'll trash for emeralds. actually exploring these pretty levels is NOT worth your time EVER, from what I can tell side paths actually having loot is based on rng so from my experience 70% of the time you end up with nothing 20% of the time you end up with emeralds and 10% of the time theres an actual chest with an item! (The chance of said item being usable being 1%...) For example I spent 20 minutes wandering through the first nether level exploring all the little nooks just to get 2 common weapons from mobs drops(I found NOTHING on the side paths) I immediately trashed. Like wow I really want to go see what garbage I can find on the next mission!

- At first combat seems cool with the rolling mechanic but because someone with a dent in their head gave it a cool down combat boils down to 2 things. A: walk up to an enemy and spam melee while tanking their attacks or B: Sit back and poke every enemy down with a bow. There is also the alternative of C which if I dipped my brain into a deep fryer and smoked some black mold I think might actually be the way the devs want you to play, walk up hit an enemy once or twice roll back and wait 10 secs for it to go off cd and repeat! Takes all the lore and aesthetics of the classic Minecraft game and puts it into an action-packed dungeon crawler. Visiting the different biomes and experiencing their tricks, loot, and different mobs was a real treat. Fun and manageable solo, even better with a party.

So, after initially liking this game for the first 4 hours, I can't recommend it.

The game is basically a crash simulator, and it's an issue for a lot of people, for a long while, it seems.

40 bucks for an unplayable game is undeniably a bad trade.

IF the game runs however, it's actually pretty okay. I liked the gameplay and I love that you can actually do the season pass on your own speed. It has a lot of interesting mechanics weapon-wise and there are actually secret chests you can find, so it's not boring to run the map.

When you consider buying it, be aware that there is a good chance that you won't be able to play it. Wait for a discount (but since there was none for the last year don't get your hopes up) or spend your money on something that is less likely to hurt your pocket.

I wish I could refund it, but since I actually managed to play over 2 hours before the crash fest began.

129966065.review:
Minecraft Dungeons is a fun re-imagination of the immensely popular and beloved game, Minecraft, as a dungeon crawler. The game expands on the already familiar mobs, both friendly and hostile, by introducing new variations as well as new mobs all-together. The world within Minecraft is truly brought to life in the movement of the player and mobs, but even more so in the graphics and sound design of the environments as well as the storytelling.

The plethora of different artifacts, gear, and enchantments create unique opportunities for combinations of abilities and special attacks to help overcome the onslaught of hostile enemies. With the game introducing seasonal events and weekly challenges replayability simply isn't a concern for me. While the game invites you to play with up to four friends, I've only had to opportunity to play alongside one. We had no issue playing between the Steam and the Minecraft Launcher versions. 

My girlfriend bought the game for me as a Christmas gift, but I ultimately wanted the game through Steam for a handful of reasons. Steam is where most of my games are located, I enjoy the community aspect and tracking achievements, and I wanted the ability the play the game mobile on the Steam Deck despite it being listed as "unsupported". I've yet to test its compatibility but will update this review when I do so.

129821935.review:
Minecraft Dungeons is a fun and addictive game that's easy to pick up and play. The game has a simple but satisfying combat system, with a good variety of weapons and abilities to choose from. The levels are well-designed, with a good mix of enemies and obstacles to overcome. The game also has a progression system that allows you to level up and unlock new gear, adding a layer of replayability.
One of the standout features of Minecraft Dungeons is its art style. The game uses the blocky aesthetic of Minecraft, but with a more colorful and cartoony look. It's a unique and charming style that sets the game apart. The music and sound effects are also well done, adding to the atmosphere.
The only downside to Minecraft Dungeons is that it can be a bit easy at times, especially if you're playing with a group of friends. The game doesn't have much in terms of difficulty options, so if you're looking for a more challenging experience, you might be disappointed.
Overall, Minecraft Dungeons is a fun and enjoyable game that's easy to pick up and play. Its simple but satisfying combat, charming art style, and replayability make it a game that's worth checking out. Just be aware that it might not provide much of a challenge for experienced gamers.

129798063.review:
One of my fave ever ARPGs, Minecraft meets Diablo! I already played via Microsoft store, and rebought it for Steam with the DLCs. It's simple to play, but oodles of fun. You can play around with so many different builds from mage, tank, rogue and archer... or mix them all up and see what happens! You can keep plenty of armor sets too, so you can even change your 'class' after every mission if you want to, which keeps things exciting. There are plenty of secrets to find (secret levels and secret loot), and lots of achievements to work towards. The game feels balanced whilst allowing the players to feel powerful at the same time, love this. If you're a fan of Minecraft or ARPGs in general, you have to try this game, it's just awesome.
PS... beware the Enderman. The creepers are watching.

129733193.review:
The first time I tried this game (through the Xbox store) I ended up uninstalling due to constant crashing errors. This version through Steam does not seem to have the same problems.

Minecraft Dungeons is more whimsical than the Diablo franchise, but still a lot of fun to play with friends. The amount of effort and detail put into this game is actually astonishing and every map has fun secrets and interesting visuals. Buildcrafting is diverse and creative and allows for a lot of unique playstyles and synergies. Most importantly, you can pet the dog in the camp.

The biggest downside--apart from occasional bugs--is some secrets are locked to a specific view of a map. If you didn't happen to randomly generate the correct view, you can't access that chest. This is especially annoying if it happens several times in a row. A fix that might help alleviate this issue is an option to remove the manual interact on doors, so even if you can't physically click on the door you can still access a hidden room if you know how to get to it.

So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my son many happy memories.

Thank you Minecraft Dungeons.

A casual but surprisingly deep ARPG. The way abilities drop as loot and gear attributes tie into the leveling progression, Minecraft Dungeons seems to take a few notes from Path of Exile without making anything very complicated. If you have your eye on this and see the Ultimate Edition go on sale, snag it while you have the chance: The sales are very few and far between.

¿Cómo hacer pociones en Minecraft?
Para hacer pociones en Minecraft hay que colocar frascos en las tres ranuras inferiores de la interfaz de elaboración de pociones y un ingrediente en la ranura superior, para que se pueda destilar el ingrediente a las botellas y las pociones pueden ser consumidas para otorgar un efecto determinado al jugador. Por ello, todas las pociones comienzan con un frasco con agua (que conseguimos al llenar un frasco de cristal con alguna fuente de agua o caldero) y añadir un ingrediente, que suele ser una verruga abisal, la cual se consigue en el Nether. A medida que progresemos en la gran aventura que supone Minecraft aprenderemos a realizar pociones y distintas recetas alquímicas. A continuación os dejamos las distintas recetas que podemos conseguir y los ingredientes correspondientes para elaborarlas.

Alquimia en Minecraft: todas las recetas e ingredientes
Debilidad: Ojo de araña fermentado
Debilidad exten.: Ojo de araña fermentado ↔ Redstone
Fuerza: Verruga abisal → Polvo de llamas
Fuerza extra: Verruga abisal → Polvo de llamas → Redstone
Fuerza II: Verruga abisal → Polvo de llamas → Polvo de piedra luminosa
Regeneración: Verruga abisal → Lágrima de ghast
Regeneración exten.: Verruga abisal → Lágrima de ghast → Redstone
Regeneración II: Verruga abisal → Lágrima de ghast → Polvo de piedra luminosa
Rapidez: Verruga abisal → Azúcar
Rapidez exten.: Verruga abisal → Azúcar → Redstone
Rapidez II: Verruga abisal → Azúcar → Polvo de piedra luminosa
Lentitud: Verruga abisal → Azúcar → Ojo de araña fermentado // Verruga abisal → Crema de magma → Ojo de araña fermentado // Nether Wart → Pata de conejo → Ojo de araña fermentado
Lentitud exten.: Verruga abisal → Azúcar → Ojo de araña fermentado ↔ Redstone // Verruga abisal → Crema de magma → Ojo de araña fermentado ↔ Redstone // Verruga abisal → Pata de conejo → Ojo de araña fermentado ↔ Redstone
Curación: Verruga abisal → Sandía reluciente
Curación II: Verruga abisal → Sandía reluciente → Polvo de piedra luminosa
Daño: Verruga abisal → Sandía reluciente → Ojo de araña fermentado // Verruga abisal → Ojo de araña → Ojo de araña fermentado
Daño II: Verruga abisal → Sandía reluciente → Ojo de araña fermentado ↔ Polvo de piedra luminosa // Verruga abisal → Ojo de araña → Ojo de araña fermentado ↔ Polvo de piedra luminosa
Veneno: Verruga abisal → Ojo de araña
Veneno exten.: Verruga abisal → Ojo de araña → Redstone
Veneno II: Verruga abisal → Ojo de araña → Polvo de piedra luminosa
Cuerpo ignífugo: Verruga abisal → Crema de magma
Cuerpo ignífugo exten.: Verruga abisal → Crema de magma → Redstone
Visión nocturna: Verruga abisal → Zanahoria dorada
Visión nocturna exten.: Verruga abisal → Zanahoria dorada → Redstone
Invisibilidad: Verruga abisal → Zanahoria dorada → Ojo de araña fermentado

Salto: Verruga abisal → Pata de conejo

125780359.review:
If you want a varied and mature dungeon crawler, I strongly advise against Minecraft Dungeons.

As Minecraft, the game really grabbed me at first. The controls are simple and the gameplay is clear. After the first levels of the campaign, in which I searched every corner for secrets as usual, I realized that the game lacked depth for my taste. You don't really have to look for hidden boxes. You stumble over them on the way through repetitive level design and always the same hordes of enemies.

The items in the game come with randomly generated perks, which offer at least a touch of variety when looting the different dungeons. However, since the items also result in the entirety of the character development, this is hardly sufficient. Leveling is therefore monotonous and doesn't exactly invite you to play the game again.
With the right combination of items you can assign yourself to a certain class, which in multiplayer makes sense here and there from the gameplay, however, it is simply worth equipping the best possible items.

The "campaign" itself also leaves a lot to be desired. These wishes are partly fulfilled with the DLCs, but could have been included in the main game.
The monotony of the opponents can also be seen in the bosses. I can count them on one hand, so I'm not really impressed.

If the flattened gameplay wasn't enough, the controls are also mouse milking. A controller may help, but if you play with a mouse and keyboard, you can expect something. You navigate by clicking through the world, but the pathing is so horrible that the character keeps running in unwanted directions or moving back and forth very quickly on the spot. Positioning yourself to jump onto a platform, for example, is an ordeal in itself, as you can only jump in the direction of travel.
If you run under a bridge or a tunnel, the game sees this as pathable terrain and moves the character in a direction unknown to the player.

I was too stingy and had to play through the game to sleep with the feeling of having thrown money out of the window. But the longer I played, the more the little things just mentioned got on my nerves. Maybe I'm just too old for a game obviously intended for a younger audience.
It just wasn't worth the 40€ to me.


- Graphic          8/10
- sound             5/10
- fun                  3/10
- Gameplay       4/10

125547740.review: I played Minecraft Dungeons at launch on PC via the MSFT Store. I loved the game then and I love the game now. It is a simple, easier take on the Diablo formula that is fun and refreshing while leaning on the popularity/nostalgia of the Minecraft franchise. Who would have guessed that one of the most popular games of all time that is based around player-driven adventure and narrative would lend itself well to another title that is based in that infinite world of storytelling and adventure? The game is not particularly challenging while providing constant dopamine hits in the form of an ever-steady stream of better and better loot. The game caters to many different playstyles and all around is mechanically sound. The game is graphically impressive for an Xbox Studios title, and the sound design is equally pleasing. I've had many, MANY issues with random crashes and being unable to play with friends, but the game is worth the hassle. I've been informed by child owners that the game is a good gateway for introducing more mechanically complex titles to your little gamers. Either way, I've had fun with this and you likely will too if you like Diablo or Torchlight.

[h1]No Mining or Crafting required[/h1]
It might look like Minecraft but its Diablo in disguise and I'm ok with this. 
Theres lots of different levels, environment biome and rewarding gear progression. 
It's generally just a fun game to grind, level and try out new gear and abilities with the theme of Minecraft that we know and love. Just feels fresh and exciting. 
Can be slow in the beginning but once you figure out the type of build/gameplay style you like it can really speed up and you blast your way through enemies. 
Theres some hidden secrets to unlock levels, seasonal challenges and an endless tower mode to test your metal. 

Not sure how the replayability will go since it’s just replaying all the same levels again on the next difficulty up but for now after finishing the main game on the base difficulty I fully intend to keep playing for the time being. 

[h1]9.3/10[/h1]
[i]- Diablo 3, 2014 vibes[/i]

124738580.review: decent game for people just starting to get into dungeon crawlers. its fun, but it has its issues. first, the controls with Keyboard + Mouse. its basically a point and click. i know its replicating other dungeon crawlers, but having both movement AND combat be tied to mouse 1 is extremely uncomfortable. controller is the way to go to play this game. 2nd issue is cloud saves. i sometimes play on and off and swap between devices on which i play. it doesnt manually save your stuff in the cloud so you have to do it manually. DONT MOVE THIS GAME TO ANOTHER DRIVE UNLESS YOU BACKUP YOUR SAVE. DOING SO WILL DELETE YOUR SAVE FILE. learned that the hard way and lost several hours of progress and lost some event exclusive items. another thing is that i wish there was an automatic inventory sorting. if you swap alot of your gear around, you will have a bunch of unsorted gear and will take a bit to find gear that you want. another issue is that just sometimes a dungeon's rng can completely ruin a run. if a mob has the worst enchantment combinations, its impossible to approach or even outright bypass and/or avoid. another thing i wish was a way to have an ingame bestiary or a guide or some sorts form some of the ingame mechanics, like which which rune combinations will get you a specific ancient during a hunt or which item can have which enchantments. final issue is that having items i cant ever obtained since i missed an event kinda sucks, as even though the event items are just reskins, its cool just collecting them and if im struggling on a level the gear is generally stronger than what i have. otherwise its an alright game. if its ever on sale and you want to get into dungeon crawling then pick it up.

I've purchased this game 3 times since it's release. 
Once on it's own launcher, once on PS4 and then once again on Steam because I wanted ease of access on the steam deck/all the DLCs I had missed. 

It's been steadily improved with features and end-game content without huge paywalls or sweeping removals to make way for these features; just pure additions. 

While it's theme is certainly similar to the Lego Games of old, with light-hearted goofiness sprinkled all around; it's still very much a fun ARPG with sinking some time into if you're a fan of the genre. Can be surprisingly difficult in the later Apocalypse tiers. (Don't attack thorns with your 1 shot Shadow build... use artifacts to kill those instead.)

Controller support works great with Steam, there's even a simple mod you can find online for the DS4 icons if you use a Dualshock 4 controller. 
Mouse and Keyboard are also viable. 
Local Co-Op play for you and another person, with up to 4 players online. 
Easy to pick up, hard to master.

122677515.review:
Honestly, I've never been a fan of Minecraft, it just was not my thing. Now I've been an avid gamer since the days of the Atari, and have always loved a good dungeon crawl. After getting Covid I needed something to pass the time. So here's my review, from someone that still does not like Minecraft! :D 

[b] Gameplay & Mechanics: 4/5 [/b]
Honestly, this is about as mindless and simple as one can get for a dungeon crawl. That being said, don't let it's simplistic nature fool you. That saying "less is more" definitely holds true with this game. The only reason this does not get a full 5 stars is that while it is simple, there is a decent lack of in-game descriptions as to how some of the mechanics work. 

[b] Visuals: 5/5 [/b]
Ok, so I've always been a fan of the 'pixel' art style, especially since I've gotten into VR gaming. This art style is also one of the reasons I never liked Minecraft. Now go figure, here I am praising them. The visuals in this game will definitely not win any state of the art lifelike awards, but it definitely fits the story and atmosphere PERFECTLY! Taken for what this game is, what Minecraft is, these visuals work. And to be honest, some of the maps truly are quite amazing... even for pixels. 

[b] Soundtrack: 4/5 [/b]
So the soundtrack to this game, by itself is rather pleasant and relaxing. If that were the only thing this rating was based on, it would be a 5. However, when you couple it with the story and different areas... some of them just don't "fit". Not to say that's a bad thing, just didn't give the proper feel in some areas. 

Side note, I listen to the soundtrack by itself for my reflective meditations in the mornings. That's how much I enjoy the actual soundtrack. 

[b] Character Development: 5/5 [/b]
Ok, so this section took me a while to figure out how I wanted to rate it. Because, frankly, there isn't any character development... not in the traditional RPG sense of the word. 

You have your character, you can pick your character's skin (that has no impact on the game in anyway), and you're off to save the world! You have a few cosmetic options, and a few more unlocked along the way. And that's it... as far as the character itself goes. Yea, I know, this sounds rather lacking for an RPG... but it's quite the opposite. You build your character with the gear you equip. You have a melee weapon, ranged weapon, armor, and 3 artifact slots. Each one of these slots offers a unique play-style. There are literally hundreds of combinations you can make for how you want to play. Throw in a basic enchantment mechanic for your gear, and you're off. 

[b] Price Point, DLC, and Cash Grab: 5/5 [/b]
So with as simple as this game is, it is in fact a dungeon crawl. And what do we do in a good ol dungeon crawl??? We farm till we can't farm anymore... then we farm some more. Always in search of the perfect drop, the perfect upgrade. 

The base game alone, coming in at $19.99 is ABSOLUTELY worth it. I have a scale, for every dollar I spend on a game, I want to get one good hour of play out of the game. Well, I've definitely gotten my money's worth. 

We move on to the DLC; with 5 different DLC packs, each one costing $5.99, I was a bit concerned. However, each one definitely offers enough content to make it worth the price. Though, I would suggest buying the Ultimate Edition for $39.99. Even if you have reservations about playing the additional content, this is a MUCH better value than buying the base game and then DLCs down the line. 

Lastly, we have that dreaded Adventure Pass. I hate.... and cannot stress this enough... [b] HATE [/b] the idea of an Adventure Pass of any kind in any game. You have me buy the game, then you have me buy the DLC to fully enjoy the game... now you want me to give you more money for rewards on playing said game? So yea... I saw this and almost instantly decided against this game all together. There are currently 2 seasons of Adventure Passes, each one costing $3.99. These are NOT included in the Ultimate Edition. (that kind of pissed me off honestly)

However, for that little price point, you get a bunch of content outside of just paid cosmetic unlockables. They actually offer additional content as well. 

So with all that, I can forgive the use of an Adventure Pass... this once. 

[b] Overall: 4.6/5 [/b]
Do you like a good ol fashioned dungeon crawl? Than go pick this game up, you won't be disappointed. 
Do you want some fancy flashy dungeon crawl that takes hours to plan out your next move, and detailed character development... this is not the game for you. Though I suggest you play it anyway.
